channel.title: Caffeinated Ponderings
channel.description:
Whether you have a slight addiction to caffeine, an irrational hatred of supermodels, or enough training in domestic peacekeeping to secure federal employment, Shana McLean Moore has the antidote to your pain. She knows you'll find it at the bottom of a hot cup of coffee, savored while taking a few minutes out of your selfless day to indulge in some of her Caffeinated Ponderings.
Shana's look at life, laughter & lattes is sure to leave you feeling tickled, validated and ready for a second cup...especially since the first one might just have escaped through your nose!
Find out how you and your friends can take a coffee break with Shana Moore at your favorite bookstore or coffee shop by visiting her Web site: www.caffeinatedponderings.com. Once you're at the site, be sure to sign up for her Fresh Brew by becoming a subscriber to her popular online newsletter.

channel.itunes:subtitle: on life, laughter & lattes

item.title: At The Check-Out
item.description: Sometimes the cost of a check-out is pricier than a cart full of fillets and Silver Oak Cabernet.
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes the cost of a check-out is pricier than a cart full of fillets and Silver Oak Cabernet.

item.title: At the Check-out
item.description: Sometimes the cost of a check-out is even greater than a cart full of fillets and Silver Oak Cabernet.
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes the cost of a check-out is even greater than a cart full of fillets and Silver Oak Cabernet.

item.title: Points of Light
item.description: If the teen magazine quizzes from your youth have spoiled any chance of your appreciating the work of Thomas Kinkade, "The Painter of Light," this is sure to tickle your funny bone... or prompt you to keep that next appointment with your therapist.
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore
item.itunes:summary: If the teen magazine quizzes from your youth have spoiled any chance of your appreciating the work of Thomas Kinkade, "The Painter of Light," this is sure to tickle your funny bone... or prompt you to keep that next appointment with your therapist.

item.title: There's No Real Harmonizing at the Barbershop
item.description: If you're a gal who looks forward to her hair appointments like a kid counting down till Christmas, while your husband views his as just a mow, blow and go, this one should tickle your funny bone.
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore
item.itunes:summary: If you're a gal who looks forward to her hair appointments like a kid counting down till Christmas, while your husband views his as just a mow, blow and go, this one should tickle your funny bone.

item.title: Are You There, God? It's Me, Margaret's Mom
item.description:
This essay is for every parent who has raised a teenage daughter.
Judy Blume's novel, "Are You There, God? It's Me, Margret," written in 1970, is now old enough to captivate a second generation of adolescent girls... and remind their mothers to be patient and understanding... and find God if they haven't already.
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore
item.itunes:summary:
This essay is for every parent who has raised a teenage daughter.
Judy Blume's novel, "Are You There, God? It's Me, Margret," written in 1970, is now old enough to captivate a second generation of adolescent girls... and remind their mothers to be patient and understanding... and find God if they haven't already.

item.title: Why IS it that... it's all relative?
item.description: Do you ever stop to think about how you evaluate your life on a bell curve instead of a strict percentage? I'll tell you-- the fact that your messy house makes my house seem clean to me is part of the reason I like you so much. And, yes, I would appreciate a thank you note for making you feel so good about your thighs.
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore

item.title: Parent Repellent
item.description: I never really pondered the plight of a bug until I made my first few trips to the trendy teen boutiques at the mall. Next time I see a roach, mosquito or ant, I'll be sure to tell them just how good they have it...
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore
item.itunes:summary: I never really pondered the plight of a bug until I made my first few trips to the trendy teen boutiques at the mall. Next time I see a roach, mosquito or ant, I'll be sure to tell them just how good they have it...

item.title: I Wanna Re-locate to Old England
item.description: Sometimes the monotony of wiping down the same kitchen counters 3 times a day can get to a girl. In fact, it can evoke all kinds of fantasies that have nothing to do with George Clooney or Matthew McConaughey. These fantasies may not be quite as sexy as George's smouldering eyes or Matthew's bulging pecs, but they at least make a girl feel like she hasan escape somewhat rosier than Thelma and Louise's.
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore

item.title: I'm Too Sexy for My Curling Iron
item.description: Truth be told, my curling iron might just be too sexy for me! It's giving me a reputation that I may just be too tired to sustain...
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore
item.itunes:summary: Truth be told, my curling iron might just be too sexy for me! It's giving me a reputation that I may just be too tired to sustain...

item.title: It Takes a Strong Foundation
item.description: Bricks, mortar and strong moral fiber be dammed! Any gal over 40 knows that the number one definition of "foundation" can be found at the make-up counter.
item.itunes:author: Shana McLean Moore
item.itunes:summary: Bricks, mortar and strong moral fiber be dammed! Any gal over 40 knows that the number one definition of "foundation" can be found at the make-up counter.
